result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara C Shaeffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting on or before December 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Added to payment plan.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
May apply for expungement after the fine and costs are paid in full, but not sooner than 1 year from November 9, 2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara C Shaeffer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sherman.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge she plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 2.  Joint recommendation for a fine.  May apply for expungement after 1 year.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  Court ordered $350 fine, plus costs and DNA surcharge.   Pay @100/mo starting 12/1.     Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid. May apply for expungement after the fine and costs are paid in full.  Not sooner than 1 year from today.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on M.K. to appear at 11/10/15 preliminary hearing.
of 8/24/15 plea hearing notice.  RTS.  not deliverable as addressed.  UTF

Pre-trial conference at 07-08-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-27-2015 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel Jon Sherman.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of the complaint; will waive time limits for the preliminary hearing; requests pretrial and status dates.  Court reviews time limits with defendant and finds she knowingly and intelligently waives the PH time limits.  Set for pretrial 7-08-15 and status 7-27-15 at 3:45.  Bond continued.  Defendant's address is ok.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
